page.title: 16Arts & crafts in Thurlow
page.content: Handicrafts have always been an accepted pastime here as in most rural areas, wives and mothers traditionally knit and crochet for their families and the Wi encourages these along with cross stitch and etching embroidery and corn dolly making. Less usual crafts include lace making, using spangle bobbins weighted by beads, adn needing from 5 pairs for a simple bookmark to over 100 for a parasol. Spinning wool is another old craft revived and which produces a lovely soft thread. Examples of patchwork can be seen, 2 inch octagons painstakingly sewn together by hand, church embroidery and basketry have enjoyed a revival, and one lady talented at soft toy making teaches this at nearby Highpoint prison. There are several good amateur photographers, a potter and a painter.
